Why do you keep bringing up other people's behavior? It's irrelevant. The only behavior a person can control is their own, so that's the only behavior Riot looks at when determining punishments. If they had to account for "but he took my lane" and "did you see what he said though" and "he was afk anyway" and "they started it" and every other excuse under the sun, there would be no punishments and the game would be crushed under the weight of this poor behavior.

By the way, what you consider "calm" is not what others consider "calm." Also, calling your teammates "losers," "useless," and "horrible" is totally unacceptable. There's never any justification for doing that.

Let's have you understand the behavioral system a bit more. Think of it like a health bar (or tension meter) in music games. When you hit the note at an off beat,  your tension meter  increases. When you completely miss a note, the meter increases by alot. When you hit the note at good timings, it reduces the meter. 

Riot's behavior system works the same way, as in we all have a toxicity meter attached to our accounts. When players are mildly toxic, it goes up a tad. When people use hate speech, it pretty much fills up the meter. of course, clean games reduce the meter. 

It is possible for playerA to get punished and playerB not to, even though playerB was waaayyyyy more toxic . Let's say playerA started the game with the toxicity meter at 95% and playerB's at 35%. Ingame, playerB said some pretty nasty shit and playerA responds with some shit as well. After the game, playerA gains 10% toxicity and playerB gains 50%. Now playerA is at 105% toxicity and gets punished, whereas playerB is at 85%, and not punished in that specific game, even though playerB was found to be 5x more toxic than playerA in that game.

Keep in mind that the reform card only shows you 1-5 recent games as examples of unacceptable behavior,  doesn't mean you were punished for those 2 games alone.

I know these can be subjective concepts. I myself was once banned for calling my teammates “weak, fleshy underlings.” Even though I meant well, enough of them reported me for it that I re-programmed my communication style. By acting diplomatic and calm, I’m now able to bend them to my will without succumbing to the forbidden dance of verbal abuse.

Sometimes it’s best to ignore the mewlings of your teammates and only focus on what you can control. If teammates anger you, try saying so out loud to yourself, not in chat where they can report you. After an annoying game, find a satisfying way to blow off steam. I’m told humans find catharsis in music, so try listening to Mozart or the dulcet sounds of “LET THE BODIES HIT THE FLOOR.”

I hope I have been useful to you. Although my heart is cold and mechanical, I feel we now have a deep connection and bond. There isn’t much more information a human specialist could provide, but if you want any further questions answered, you may select the option below.
This isn't a competition about who flamed the least. You BOTH flamed.

The rules are simple.
Your logs are examined out of context.
Chat should be used for strategic calls and rallying your team.
If you notice inappropriate behaviour towards you or another player, you mute and then report at the end screen, replying or defending yourself is no excuse for further inappropriate behaviour.

These are not _debatable_ 

In the future, just don't type at all if you can't keep your cool, and I would advise you to /muteall at the start of each game
